alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Portage (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:57PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Portage and southeastern Marathon Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 757 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Mosinee, or 12 miles southwest of Wausau, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mosinee around 815 PM CDT. Bevent around 845 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Big Eau Pleine County Park, Elderon, Pike Lake, Moon, North Star, Holt, Peplin, Shantytown, Rocky Corners and Halder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
